The header is leaving taller stubble near the center of the header or the header is pushing material near the end of the wing. Decrease the wing down force.

block.para: Wing Down Force Wing Down Force adjusts down force isolated to either side of the header.
Slider Gauge Slider Gauge indicates current down force value for each side of the header.
Adjustment Adjustment push plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease down force for either side of the header.

block.head: Access Grain Handling

step.para: Menu Menu
Machine Settings Machine Settings tab
Grain Handling Grain Handling

block.para: Grain Handling Press Grain Handling button on navigation bar below display.

block.head: Grain Handling Main Page

note.para: Grain Handling Underscored text identifies that additional information is available within this section or another section of this publication.
Main page shown is for example only. Your main page may differ depending on options or connected equipment.

block.para: Grain Handling application is used to access and modify Grain Level settings, Moisture, and Accuracy. Advanced Settings are used to modify Grain Level Auto Beacon, Tank Unloading Offset, and Custom Level Alarm.

note.para: Some items below are only displayed if machine is equipped with the associated option.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Grain Handling Main Page:

block.para: Moisture Moisture enable or disable moisture alarm, set maximum and minimum moisture alarm settings, and set moisture correction.
Yield Calibration Accuracy access Yield Calibration.
Grain Level Grain Level displays current grain tank level.
Set Full Level Set Full Level set grain tank full level.
Set Empty Level Set Empty Level set grain tank empty level.
Adjustable Spout Adjustable Spout displays position information and setting adjustments for the unloading auger if equipped with adjustable spout.
Advanced Settings Advanced Settings access further adjustments and less common settings.
Modules for this application can be added to run pages using Layout Manager.
Example:
Grain Level Grain Level gives you direct access to Grain Level application.

note.para: Different modules can be available for your application.

block.head: Advanced Settings
block.para: Advanced Settings allows you to access further adjustments and less common settings.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Advanced Settings Page:

block.para: Checkbox Grain Level Auto Beacon beacon light illuminates when grain tank is 3/4 full or is full.
Offset Tank Unloading Offset adjust grain tank empty level if all grain is not emptied from the grain tank or unloading auger continues to run after grain tank is empty.
Custom Alarm Level Custom Alarm Level message appears on the screen when selected grain level has been met.
Custom Alarm Level Input Box Custom Alarm Level Input Box select to edit custom alarm level.
Spout Cleanout Spout Cleanout spout automatically repositions to the cleanout position to remove any remaining grain after the unloading auger disengages.
Field Transport Position Field Transport Position select the position the spout should move to after unloading and spout cleanout is complete.

block.object_name: Advanced Settings - Grain Level Auto Beacon
block.head: Advanced Settings | Grain Level Auto Beacon
block.para: Grain Level Auto Beacon illuminates when grain tank is 3/4 full or is full.

item.para: Enable or disable Grain Level Auto Beacon.
Provide a signal that the grain tank is 3/4 or full.

block.para: Checkbox Select to enable or disable Grain Level Auto Beacon.

block.head: Advanced Settings | Tank Unloading Offset
block.para: Tank Unloading Offset allows you to adjust grain tank empty level if all grain is not emptied from grain tank or grain level does not show 0% after grain tank is empty. Different crops, weights, and moisture can affect grain tank level sensor readings.

item.para: Grain remains in tank after grain tank level reads 0%.
Grain tank is emptied before grain tank level reads 0%.
Decrease offset value if grain remains in tank when grain tank level reads 0%.
Increase offset value if grain tank is emptied before grain tank level reads 0%.

block.para: Decrease Select to decrease value.
Increase Select to increase value.
Minimum: -15 bu/sec
Maximum: 15 bu/sec
Increment: (+/-) 0.5 bu/sec

block.head: Advanced Settings | Custom Alarm Level
block.para: Custom Alarm Level allows you to enable a message to appear on the screen when selected grain level has been met.

item.para: Enable or disable Custom Alarm Level.
Set an additional earlier notification of the grain tank level other than 3/4 full or full.
Set a lower alarm threshold.

step.para: ON/OFF Select to enable or disable Custom Alarm Level.
Input Box Select to open number pad and enter desired value.
OK Select OK to save value.

note.para: When custom alarm level is met, a message appears on-screen. The message can be viewed in the Status Center on the display.

block.head: Grain Level
block.para: Grain Level allows you to set correct grain tank Full Level or grain tank Empty Level if grain level is not reading correctly.

item.para: Grain is spilling over the sides when operating in hilly conditions. Set a lower grain tank level.
The grain tank is full and you want to set the Grain Level as 100%. Select the "Set Full Level" button to calibrate the 100% reading.
The grain tank is empty but the system is still unloading. Select the "Set Empty Level" button to calibrate the empty reading.
Set Full Level Select to save grain tank full level.
Set Empty Level Select to save grain tank zero level.

note.para: Selecting Set Empty Level will automatically adjust Tank Unloading Offset.
Grain level 3/4 full and full beacon adjusts based on grain level.

block.head: Moisture Settings
block.para: Moisture Settings allows you to enable or disable moisture alarm, set maximum and minimum moisture alarm settings, set moisture correction, and enable or disable Use Fixed Moisture.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Moisture Settings Page:

block.para: ON/OFF ON/OFF enable or disable Moisture Alarm.
Maximum Moisture Value Maximum Moisture upper limit to activate the moisture alarm.
Minimum Moisture Value Minimum Moisture lower limit to activate the moisture alarm.
Correction Value Correction amount of correction needed to match a certified moisture measurement.
Unchecked Use Fixed Moisture enable or disable fixed moisture.
Fixed Moisture Value Use Fixed Moisture fixed moisture level.
Advanced Settings Advanced Settings further Moisture Settings adjustments and less common settings.

block.head: Moisture Alarm
block.para: Moisture Alarm allows you to enable or disable the Moisture Alarm that sounds when moisture value drops below minimum or above maximum setting.

item.para: Enable or disable the Moisture Alarm.
Adjust the minimum moisture percentage.
Adjust the maximum moisture percentage.
ON/OFF Select to enable or disable Moisture Alarm.
Maximum Select to set percentage for alarm to sound when moisture percentage is above value.
Minimum: 1%
Maximum: 60%
Minimum Select to set percentage for alarm to sound when moisture percentage is belowvalue.
Minimum: 1%
Maximum: 50%

note.para: Maximum moisture percentage must be set higher than minimum moisture percentage.

block.head: Moisture Correction
block.para: Moisture Correction allows you to toggle between Moisture Correction or Fixed Moisture, adjust the value when moisture percentage measured by combine moisture sensor differs from the elevator certified moisture, and disable moisture sensor reading and force a preset moisture value.

item.para: Toggle between moisture correction and fixed moisture.
Change amount of correction needed to match a certified moisture reading.
Change fixed moisture level used when the fixed moisture feature is enabled.

block.para: Set moisture correction to difference between combine moisture sensor and elevator certified moisture sensor. {Example: elevator moisture (13%) minus combine measured moisture (12%) = moisture difference (+1%)}

step.para: Checked If Use Fixed Moisture is checked, deselect checkbox to enable Correction.
Value Select to open number pad and enter desired value.
OK Select OK to save value.

note.para: Moisture correction can be a positive or negative number.

step.para: Unchecked If Use Fixed Moisture is not checked, select checkbox to enable.
Value Select to open number pad and enter desired value.
OK Select OK to save value.

block.head: Status Center
block.para: Status Center provides status and quick access for Grain Handling functions. See Display Overview for more information.

para.emph: Items Accessible for Grain Handling in Status Center:

block.para: Unloading Auger Unloading Auger Swung Out auger is out.
Unloading Auger Engaged Unloading Auger Engaged auger is currently unloading.
Grain Level Grain Level shown as 3/4.

note.para: Selecting Set Empty Level automatically adjusts Tank Unloading Offset.
Grain level 3/4 and full beacon adjusts based on grain level.

block.head: Adjustable Spout
block.para: Active Spout displays the desired position and target position of the unloading auger spout and allows you to adjust the spout manually or to a preset position.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Adjustable Spout Page:

block.para: Radial Gauge Radial Gauge displays the usable range, target position, and desired position of the spout.
Desired Position Desired Position indicates the position the spout will move to within the usable range.
Target Position Target Position indicates the position the spout will move to when the Move To Target button is pressed.
Desired Position Value Desired Position Value displays the desired position in a percentage value within the usable range of the spout.
Increase Increase press to move the spout away from the machine.
Decrease Decrease press to move the spout towards the machine.
Set Target Set Target press to set the target position.
Move To Target Move To Target press to move to the target position.

note.para: The Set Target and Move To Target buttons will conditionally enable/disable based on the spout state.

block.para: Unloading Auger Engaged Unloading Auger Engaged shown while the unloading auger is engaged.
Fault Fault shown when a fault locks the adjustable spout system. A contextual message will inform you of the reason for the condition.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shown if adjustable spout is not fully unfolded. Adjustments cannot be made until adjustable spout is fully unfolded.

item.para: You want to adjust the position of the spout.
You want to set the target position the spout will return to when the Move To Target button is pressed.

Increase
Decrease Adjust the spout to the desired position using the Increase and Decrease buttons.
Set Target To set the current position of the spout as the target position, press the Set Target button.
Go To Target To return the spout to the target position you have set, press the Move To Target button.
Scroll Wheel To adjust the position of the spout using the scroll wheel on the multi-function lever:
Scroll the wheel right (clockwise) to move the spout towards the machine (down).
Scroll the wheel left (counterclockwise) to move the spout away from the machine (up).
Reconfigurable Buttons To adjust the position of the spout using the C or D reconfigurable buttons on the multi-function lever:
Press down on the rocker switch to move the spout towards the machine (down).
Press up on the rocker switch to move the spout away from the machine (up).

note.para: This procedure describes the default settings. This procedure may not apply if you previously configured new assignments or custom presets on the multi-function lever.

block.head: Spout Cleanout
block.para: Spout Cleanout allows you to make adjustments to adjustable spout automation operations after the unloading auger disengages.

item.para: Message appears on-screen to indicate that spout automation has been disabled and the system wants to re-enable spout automation.
Operator does not desire for the spout to move through a cleanout cycle after the unloading auger has been disengaged.

note.para: This means the spout will not automatically attempt to tilt downwards to clear residual grain from the boot.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Spout Cleanout Page:

block.para: Spout Cleanout ON/OFF Spout Cleanout ON/OFF select to enable or disable spout cleanout.
Cleanout Position Cleanout Position controls the position of the adjustable spout for removal of any remaining grain after unloading.
Minimum: 0%
Maximum: 100%
Increment: (+/-) 10%
Cleanout Start Delay Cleanout Start Delay controls the amount of delay time after unloading and before moving to the cleanout position.
Minimum: 0 sec
Maximum: 10 sec
Increment: (+/-) 0.5 sec
Time at Cleanout Position Time at Cleanout Position controls the amount of time the adjustable spout remains at the cleanout position.
Minimum: 0 sec
Maximum: 10 sec
Increment: (+/-) 0.5 sec
Decrease Select to decrease value.
Increase Select to increase value.

block.head: Field Transport Position
block.para: Field Transport Position allows you to select the position the spout should move to after unloading and spout cleanout is complete (if enabled).

para.emph: Items Accessible on Field Transport Position Page:

block.para: Fixed Position Fixed Position the spout moves to the position set on the Advanced Settings page. When using fixed position, the spout returns to the target automatically at the next unloading auger engagement.
Target Position Target Position the spout moves to the currently saved target after each unloading auger disengagement and cleanout.
Current Position Current Position the spout returns to its last position after completing a cleanout.

note.para: If the spout is adjusted at any point after an auger disengagement, automation is suspended for the next engagement and will resume at the next disengagement. This means the spout will not automatically move to the target prior to the unloading auger engaging.

item.para: Message appears on-screen to indicate that spout automation has been disabled and the system wants to re-enable spout automation.
Operator desires the spout to be configured to move to a different position after a spout cleanout is completed.
Operator desires to the spout to move to a different position after the auger has been disengaged.

block.para: Radio Button Select the position of the spout by pressing the radio button next to the desired setting.
If selecting Go to Fixed Position setting:

item.para: Press the plus (+) button to increase percentage.
Press the minus (-) button to decrease percentage.

block.para: Minimum: 0%
Maximum: 100%
Increment: (+/-) 10%

block.head: Access Folding

step.para: Menu Menu
Machine Settings Machine Settings tab
Folding Folding

block.para: Folding Press Folding button on navigation bar below display.

block.head: Folding Main Page

note.para: Folding Underscored text identifies that additional information is available within this section or another section of this publication.
Main page shown is for example only. Your main page may differ depending on options or connected equipment.

block.para: Folding Application is used to operate folding equipment.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Folding Main Page:

note.para: Some items below are only displayed if machine is equipped with the associated option.

block.para: Lock/Unlock Grain Tank Covers lock or unlock the folding function buttons for the grain tank covers.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.
Lock/Unlock Adjustable Spout lock or unlock the folding function buttons for the adjustable spout.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.

note.para: Adjustable spout buttons may look slightly different depending on the field transport position setting selected in the Grain Handling application.

block.para: Lock/Unlock Fountain Auger lock or unlock the folding function buttons for the fountain auger.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.
Lock/Unlock Folding Unloading Auger lock or unlock the folding function buttons for the folding unloading auger.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.
Lock/Unlock Header Transport Position lock or unlock the transport readiness function buttons for the extendable platform.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.
Lock/Unlock Folding Corn Head lock or unlock folding function buttons for the corn head.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.
Lock/Unlock Folding Corn Head lock or unlock folding function buttons for the corn head.
Content Blocker Content Blocker shows locked status. Prevents accidental engagement of the function. Press and hold to disengage.
Manual Control Manual Controlany abnormal state causes the control frame to display the Manual Control icon link push button.

note.para: This applies to any subsystem affected by the position sensor issue or any other issue.

block.head: Grain Tank Covers
block.para: Grain Tank Covers application allows you to open and close grain tank covers from within the cab.

caution.para: Avoid power line entanglement. Grain tank covers must be closed before transporting machine.

important.para: Unload grain before closing grain tank covers.

note.para: Grain tank covers must be fully opened in order to engage separator.

item.para: Configure machine for field operation.
Service machine components.
Configure machine for road transportation or storage.
Clean out machine.

note.para: Position Unknown Error When a position unknown error is present on Grain Tank Covers, one-touch folding is unavailable. Select and hold buttons to fold or unfold grain tank covers.
You can press the quick-stop switch on multi-function lever at any time to stop all movement controlled by the Folding application. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

step.para: Lock/Unlock Select to unlock folding and unfolding buttons.
Select desired button to fold or unfold grain tank covers.

item.para: Open Select to fully open grain tank covers.
Close Select to close grain tank covers.
Progress Indicator Displays progress of grain tank covers when opening and closing.

note.para: Open/Close You can interrupt grain tank cover movement at any time by selecting either of the action buttons. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

item.para:
Fully Open
Fully Closed Folding status is displayed on screen when action is complete.

note.para: Lock System automatically changes to locked status 30 seconds after last button selection.

Locked state prevents you from accessing folding controls, however it does not stop equipment that is already in motion. Locked state does not block physical controls that can be assigned to actuate movement in Controls Setup application.

block.head: Adjustable Spout
block.para: Adjustable Spout application allows you to fold and unfold the adjustable spout from within the cab.

item.para: Configure machine for field operation.
Configure machine for road transportation.

note.para: Position Unknown Error When a position unknown error is present on Adjustable Spout, one-touch folding is unavailable. Select and hold buttons to fold or unfold adjustable spout.
You can press the quick-stop switch on the multi-function lever at any time to stop all movement controlled by the Folding application. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

item.para: Lock/Unlock Select to unlock folding and unfolding buttons.
Select desired button to fold or unfold grain tank covers.
Unfold Select to fully unfold adjustable spout.

note.para: Adjustable spout button may look slightly different depending on the field transport position setting selected in the Grain Handling application.

item.para: Fold Select to fully fold adjustable spout.

block.para: Progress Indicator Displays progress of the adjustable spout when folding and unfolding.

note.para: Unfolded/Folded You can interrupt adjustable spout movement at any time by selecting either of the action buttons. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

item.para:
Fully Unfolded
Fully Folded Folding status is displayed on screen when action is complete.

note.para: Lock/Unlock System automatically changes to locked status 30 seconds after last button selection.

Locked state prevents you from accessing folding controls, however it does not stop equipment that is already in motion. Locked state does not block physical controls that can be assigned to actuate movement in Controls Setup application.

block.head: Fountain Auger
block.para: Fountain Auger application allows you to raise and lower the fountain auger from within the cab.

item.para: Configure machine for field operation.
Configure machine for road transportation.

note.para: Position Unknown Error When a position unknown error is present on Fountain Auger, one-touch raising is unavailable. Select and hold buttons to raise or lower fountain auger.
You can press the quick-stop switch on the multi-function lever at any time to stop all movement controlled by the Folding application. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

item.para: Lock/Unlock Select to unlock raise and lower buttons.
Select desired button to raise or lower fountain auger.
Raise Select to fully raise fountain auger.
Lower Select to fully lower fountain auger.

block.para: Progress Indicator Displays progress of the fountain auger when raising and lowering.

note.para: Raised/Lowered You can interrupt fountain auger movement at any time by selecting either of the action buttons. Resume raising or lowering by selecting desired button.

block.para:
Fully Raised
Fully Lowered Folding status is displayed on screen when action is complete.

note.para: Lock/Unlock System automatically changes to locked status 30 seconds after last button selection.

Locked state prevents you from accessing folding controls, however it does not stop equipment that is already in motion. Locked state does not block physical controls that can be assigned to actuate movement in Controls Setup application.

block.head: Folding Unloading Auger
block.para: Folding Unloading Auger allows you to fold and unfold the folding unloading auger as required.

item.para: Configure machine for field operation.
Service machine components.
Configure machine for road transportation or storage.

note.para: Position Unknown Error When a position unknown error is present on the folding unloading auger, one-touch folding is unavailable. Select and hold buttons to fold or unfold auger tip.
You can press the quick-stop switch on the multi-function lever at any time to stop all movement controlled by the Folding application. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

step.para: Unlock Select to unlock folding and unfolding buttons.
Select desired button to fold or unfold the auger tip.

item.para: Unfold Select to unfold auger tip.
Fold Select to fold the auger tip.
Progress Indicator Displays progress of auger tip when folding and unfolding.

note.para: Unfold/Fold You can interrupt auger tip folding movement at any time by selecting either of the action buttons. Resume folding by selecting desired button.

item.para:
Fully Unfolded
Fully Folded Folding status is displayed on screen when action is complete.

note.para: Locked System automatically changes to locked status 30 seconds after last button selection.

Locked state prevents you from accessing folding controls, however it does not stop equipment that is already in motion. Locked state does not block physical controls that can be assigned to actuate movement in Controls Setup application.

block.head: Header Transport Position
block.para: Header Transport Position application allows you to prepare an extendable platform header for transport from within the cab.

item.para: Configure header fortrailer transportation.
Configure header for road transportation.

para.emph: Items Adjusted When Header Transport Position is Engaged:

item.para: Cutterbar is retracted.
Reel is lowered.
Reel is retracted to the extendable cutterbar.

note.para: Position Unknown Error When a position unknown error is present on header transport position, one-touch automatic length adjustment is unavailable. Select and hold the button to engage header transport position.

A position unknown error is displayed if any system is unable to obtain a position reading, but the button can still be activated. The position unknown error will remain present after the system moves to transport.
You can press the quick-stop switch on the multi-function lever at any time to stop all movement controlled by the Folding application. Resume stow by selecting header transport activation button.

step.para: Lock/Unlock Select to unlock the header transport position activation button.
Header Transport Position Activation Button Select and hold the header transport position activation button to begin placing the header into transport position.

block.para: Progress Indicator Displays the progress of placing the header in transport position.

item.para:
Not In Transport Position
In Transport Position Folding status is displayed on-screen when action is complete.

note.para: Lock/Unlock System automatically changes to locked status 30 seconds after last button selection.

caution.para: Locked state prevents you from accessing folding controls. However, it does not stop equipment that is already in motion. Locked state also does not block physical controls that can be assigned in the Controls Setup application from actuating movement if a control is pressed.

block.head: Manual Control
block.para: Manual Control displays subsystem features that are malfunctioning or have been placed into manual control mode.

note.para: This does not include all subsystems, only those experiencing or affected by position sensor issues.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Manual Control Page:

block.para: Displayed below are examples of attention frames that may appear on subsystems experiencing an issue. Subsystems not experiencing an issue will still be displayed, but without the sensor error or calibration required attention frames.

block.head: Access Harvest Settings

step.para: Menu Menu
Machine Settings Machine Settings tab
Harvest Settings Harvest Settings

block.para: Harvest Settings Press the Harvest Settings button on the navigation bar below the display.

block.head: Harvest Settings Main Page

note.para: Harvest Settings Underscored text identifies that additional information is available within this section or another section of this publication.
Main page shown is for example only. Your main page may differ depending on options or connected equipment.

block.para: Harvest Settings is used to adjust the threshing and cleaning performance for minimum harvest loss based on crop harvested and crop conditions.

note.para: Some items below are only displayed if machine is equipped with the associated option.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Harvest Settings Main Page:

block.para: Load Harvest Settings Load Harvest Settings allows you to make default selections on Presets, Threshing Conditions, and Straw/Cob Conditions to help grain cleanliness and grain loss.
Performance Target Performance Target allows you to select the acceptable grain loss for your machine.

Set To Current Set to Current select to set the height total loss column of the VisionTrak display to the current loss level. When pressed, the height total loss column is adjusted to the center of the column.
On older machines, selecting Set to Current also changes the "acceptable loss" level in HarvestSmart.
Threshing Clearance Threshing Clearance allows you to modify the threshing clearance.
Threshing Speed Threshing Speed allows you to modify the threshing speed.
Cleaning Fan Cleaning Fan allows you to modify the fan speed.
Outside Configuration Outside Configuration shows the external machine adjustmentsthat must be made prior to harvesting a selected crop type.
Advanced Settings Advanced Settings allows you to access further adjustments and less common settings.
Chaffer Clearance Chaffer Clearance allows you to modify the opening of the chaffer elements.
Sieve Clearance Sieve Clearance allows you to modify the opening of the sieve elements.
Modules for this application can be added to the run pages using Layout Manager.
Example:
Clearance Clearance allows you to adjust the threshing clearance.

note.para: Different modules can be available for your application.

block.head: Load Harvest Settings
block.para: Load Harvest Settings allows you to make default selections on Presets, Threshing Conditions, and Straw/Cob Conditions to help grain cleanliness and grain loss.

note.para: Changing Crop Type in Work Setup causes change in harvest settings. See Effects of Crop Change for further information.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Load Harvest Settings Page:

block.para: Preset allows you to select defaults, previous preset values, and adjust previous preset values to adjust to crop conditions.
Threshing Conditions allows you to describe the threshing conditions so the system can help determine correct machine settings.
Straw Conditions allows you to describe the straw/cob conditions so the system can help determine correct machine settings.
Settings Preview displays the current settings and displays your setting changes in bold in the "New" column.

note.para: If any automated adjustment is made by the system, the values update to provide you the most current value.

block.para: Threshing Clearance Threshing Clearance
Threshing Speed Threshing Speed
Cleaning Fan Cleaning Fan
Chaffer Clearance Chaffer Clearance
Sieve Clearance Sieve Clearance
Save Preset Save Preset allows you to save changes made to Presets, Threshing Conditions, and Straw/Cob Conditions.

note.para: Auto Maintain performance can be reduced if settings differ from the selected preset. Create a new preset with the current settings for best performance.

block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Preset
block.para: Preset allows you to select from a list of saved machine configurations for a given crop.

item.para: You want to create a preset to capture the harvest settings that provide the desired performance and grain quality for the crop and conditions that you are harvesting.
You want to create a new custom preset when working with Auto Maintain and your settings are very different from the actual preset.

step.para: Load Harvest Settings Select to open.

note.para: Other than corn, all other crop types are listed with default first, then clean out option, and finally, all of your created presets in alphabetical order.

step.para: Preset Select to open Select Preset.
Select Preset Select desired preset.
OK Select to save preset and return to Load Harvest Settings.

note.para: Current / New As you select a different preset, the "New" column of Settings Preview updates to display the settings change in bold.
When presets for defaults are changed, the "New" column value in the Settings Preview changes. Defaults remain unchanged when changing presets within the crop type.
If the New Threshing Speed is outside the current rotor drive gear range, an overlay may show to prompt you to change the gear.
When modifications are made to the selected preset, the word (Modified) is added to the name.

step.para: Load Harvest Settings Select to open Preset.
Preset Select to open Select Preset.
Select Preset Select desired preset.
Delete Select to delete preset.

note.para: Presets that you created can be deleted. If pressed, a message dialogue is shown to confirm the delete action on the preset.

step.para: Cancel Select to cancel if you do not wish to delete the selected preset.

note.para: Manually record data by hand before deleting. If you delete a preset, it is removed from the display and cannot be undone.

step.para: OK Select to delete the preset.

block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Threshing Conditions
block.para: Threshing Conditions allows you to select from three options to choose the best description of your current threshing conditions.

item.para: There is unthreshed grain or kernels with hull present in the sample. Set to Difficult.
A satisfactory sample is created using the threshing settings within the recommended range for that crop. Set to Normal.
Grain separates from the hull or cob before entering the threshing section. Set to Easy.

note.para: For small grain crops, rubbing a grain head in between your fingers gives a good indication of how easy the grain will thresh. Rub the head in between your fingers until all the kernels are out of the their husks:

item.para: Easy around 4 rubs of the grain head.
Normal around 8 rubs of the grain head.
Difficult around 15 rubs of the grain head.

step.para: Load Harvest Settings Select to open.
Threshing Conditions Select the Threshing Conditions list box to open list of the threshing conditions.
Select the desired threshing condition.

item.para: Difficult increased threshing aggressiveness to reduce unthreshed grain.
Normal regular settings for ordinary harvest conditions.
Easy decreased threshing aggressiveness to reduce power consumption and grain damage.

step.para: Cancel Select to cancel if you do not wish to change.
OK Select to save the Threshing Condition.

note.para: Once selected, the system begins adjusting the settings to match the selected preset you have chosen.

step.para: Close Select to close.

block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Straw Conditions
block.para: Straw Conditions allows you to select from three options to choose the best description of your current straw condition.

item.para: Harvesting tough, wet straw, green stems, or lots of material other than grain is being processed. Set to Difficult.
Ordinary material handling for the crop is present. Set to Normal.
Harvesting very dry straw or stems that break easily, creating an undesirable sample. Set to Brittle.

note.para: Pick a handful of standing straw and twist it. Twisting a handful of straw gives a good indication of straw conditions.

item.para: Difficult straw will not break even when twisted more than 10 times.
Normal straw starts to break after twisting it a few times.
Brittle straw breaks easily when starting to twist it.

step.para: Load Harvest Settings Select to open.
Straw Conditions Select Straw Conditions list box.
Select the desired Straw Condition.

item.para: Difficult improves material flow in tough or wet straw.
Normal regular settings for ordinary harvest conditions.
Brittle decreases straw breakage to reduce cleaning shoe load.

step.para: Cancel Select to cancel if you do not wish to change the Preset Modifiers.
OK Select to save Straw Condition.

note.para: Once selected, the system begins adjusting the settings to match the selected preset you have chosen.

step.para: Close Select to close.

block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Save Preset
block.para: Save Preset allows you to create a new preset or to update the last preset you used.
Default Preset allows you to change default presets and save them as your own custom preset.
Custom Preset allows you to either update an existing custom preset or create a preset.

block.object_name: Load Harvest Settings - Save Preset - Factory Default
block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Save Preset | Factory Default
block.para: Default Presets are factory loaded settings for each combination of Threshing Condition and Straw/Cob Quality for a given crop. You can modify these defaults and save them as a new name based on your harvesting conditions.
You want to create your own preset to capture the harvest settings that provide the desired performance and grain quality for the crop and conditions that you are harvesting.

step.para: Load Harvest Settings Select to access the Load Harvest Settings page.
Save Preset Select to save the preset as a new name.
Use the keyboard to enter the name of this customized setting.
Cancel Select to cancel if you do not want to save the preset.
OK Select to save the preset.

block.object_name: Load Harvest Settings - Save Preset - Custom Preset
block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Save Preset | Custom Preset
block.para: Custom Presets are defined by you based on your harvesting conditions. These can be modified as crop conditions or machine performance changes.

item.para: Harvesting different varieties of a particular crop.
Harvesting at different times of the day (morning and evening versus afternoon).
Harvesting in different grain moisture (wet crop versus dry crop).
Operating with Auto Maintain.

step.para: Load Harvest Settings Select to access the Load Harvest Settings page.
Save Preset Select to save the preset and activate the keyboard.
Select an option to save the current Harvest Setting.
Enter a new Preset name
"Corn"
Cancel Select to cancel if you do not wish to save the preset.
OK Select to save the preset.

block.object_name: Load Harvest Settings - Effects of Crop Change
block.head: Load Harvest Settings | Effects of Crop Change
block.para: Changing the crop type in Work Setup also makes changes to the Load Harvest Settings.
Cancel Selecting Cancel on the Load Harvest Settings page while changing crop type in Work Setup results in the combine not being adjusted.

note.para: The "Preset" indication shown on the Harvest Settings main page shows "- -" until a new preset is loaded.

block.para: OK Selecting OK changes the Load Harvest Settings based on the crop selected.

item.para: If the crop type has never been used, the factory default settings are set.

If the last used settings were a preset, the preset is selected, the last used threshing and straw conditions are selected, and individual settings are set to last use (matching the preset and conditions set).
Preset If the last used settings were custom, the Preset shows {PresetName}* and the individual settings are set to the last used.

note.para: If the new value for Threshing Speed is outside of the current rotor drive gear range, an overlay may show to prompt you to change the gear.
Several harvesting functions are affected by the selected crop type preset. It is important to change the preset to match the crop being harvested.

block.head: Current Settings | Threshing Clearance
block.para: Threshing Clearance allows you to modify the threshing clearance for varying crops and conditions.

note.para: For the threshing clearance settings, refer to Crop Settings section in your Operator's Manual.

item.para: Improve straw quality; make longer straw and generates less breakage of material.
Improve grain quality; reduce splits and grain damage.
Reduce power consumption; for easy threshing grain.
Improve sample cleanliness; reduce chaff load on the cleaning shoe.
Reduce unthreshed separator loss, such as unhulled grain or grain on the cob behind the machine.
Improve grain tank sample; reduce kernels with husks or unopened pods.

block.para: Adjustment States depending on machine options, different adjustment states may appear as current settings are changed.

step.para: Threshing Clearance Select to set the threshing clearance.
Adjustment Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease threshing clearance, or select the input field and use the Armrest Adjustment Dial to make desired clearance changes.

item.para:
Input Field
Armrest Adjustment Dial Turn the dial clockwise to increase the value.
Turn the dial counterclockwise to decrease the value.

note.para: Depending on machine configurations, some values may not be reached.
Maximum value may not be attainable if dense pack elements are installed.

step.para: Minimum: 0
Maximum: 42
Increment: 1
Close Select to close.

block.head: Current Settings | Threshing Speed
block.para: Threshing Speed allows you to modify the threshing speed for varying crop conditions.

note.para: For the threshing speed settings, refer to Crop Settings section in your Operator's Manual. If the crop is being under-threshed, first attempt to solve the problem by decreasing the threshing clearance before adjusting the threshing speed. If the crop or straw is being damaged, try reducing the threshing speed first to solve the problem before adjusting the threshing clearance.

item.para: Allow grain to be removed from the other crop material before it escapes the separator.
Improve material flow.
Achieve more capacity in tough material conditions.
Improve handling in tough straw.
Reduce the risk of plugging when taking in large amounts of material.
Reduce power consumption; reduce threshing speed in easy threshing grain for improved efficiency.
Improve grain sample quality; generate less chaff and foreign material in the cleaning shoe by reducing threshing speed.
Reduce grain damage; broken kernels and splits can occur if the threshing speed is too fast, even if the concave clearance is set correctly.

block.para: Adjustment States depending on machine options, different adjustment states may appear as current settings are changed.

note.para: The threshing speed may increase about 30 rpm over 4 hours as the oil temperature increases. Adjust the speed as necessary.

step.para: Engage the separator and run the engine at high idle.
Threshing Speed Select to modify the threshing speed.
Adjustment Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease speed or select the input field and use the Armrest Adjustment Dial to make desired speed changes.

item.para:
Input Field
Armrest Adjustment Dial Turn the dial clockwise to increase the value.
Turn the dial counterclockwise to decrease the value.

note.para: Threshing has a two-speed gear case, with high and low speeds. Minimum and Maximum values may require you to change the gear case setting. See Operator's Manual for further information on which speed should be selected.
Depending on machine configurations, some values may not be reached.

step.para: Minimum: 300 rpm
Maximum: 1300 rpm
Increment: 10 rpm
Close Select to close.

block.head: Current Settings | Cleaning Fan
block.para: Cleaning Fan Speed allows you to modify the fan speed to improve grain cleanliness and reduce grain loss.

note.para: For the fan speed settings, refer to Crop Settings section in your Operator's Manual.

item.para: Improve sample quality; reduce the amount of chaff or light material other than grain in the grain tank by blowing it out.
Reduce cleaning shoe loss due to insufficient aeration; lighter grains can become trapped in chaff.
Reduce cleaning shoe loss; smaller, lighter grains can be carried out of the cleaning shoe if the cleaning fan speed is too high.

block.para: Adjustment States depending on machine options, different adjustment states may appear as current settings are changed.

step.para: Engage the separator and run the engine at high idle.
Cleaning Fan Speed Select to set the cleaning fan speed.
Adjustment Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease speed or select the input field and use the Armrest Adjustment Dial to make desired speed changes.

item.para:
Input Field
Armrest Adjustment Dial Turn the dial clockwise to increase the value.
Turn the dial counterclockwise to decrease the value.

note.para: Minimum and Maximum values may change if machine is equipped with a cleaning fan slow down kit.

step.para: Minimum: 570 rpm
Maximum: 1430 rpm
Increment: 10 rpm
Close Select to close.

block.head: Current Settings | Chaffer Clearance
block.para: Chaffer Clearance allows you to modify the opening of the chaffer elements to improve the grain cleanliness and reduce the cleaning shoe loss for varying crops and conditions.

note.para: For the chaffer clearance settings, refer to Crop Settings section in your Operator's Manual.

item.para: Reduce cleaning shoe loss; allows the grain to fall through sooner before it can escape the cleaning shoe.
Allow the grain to fall through sooner before it is forced into the tailings.

note.para: Opening of the chaffer will also decrease pressure in the cleaning shoe. Large adjustments could require readjustment of the fan speed.

item.para: Improve sample quality; reduce the amount of larger, foreign material in the grain tank.
Reduce high tailings volume when it does not contain free grain.

block.para: Adjustment States depending on machine options, different adjustment states may appear as current settings are changed.

step.para: Chaffer Clearance Select to set the chaffer clearance.
Adjustment Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease the desired chaffer clearance.

Input Field
Armrest Adjustment Dial Turn the dial clockwise to increase the value.
Turn the dial counterclockwise to decrease the value.

note.para: Depending on machine configurations, some values may not be reached.

step.para: Minimum: 0
Maximum: 22
Increment: 1
Minimum: 0
Maximum: 30
Increment: 1
Close Select to close.

block.head: Current Settings | Sieve Clearance
block.para: Sieve Clearance allows you to modify the opening of the sieve to improve grain cleanliness and manage tailings volumes for varying crops and conditions.

note.para: For the sieve clearance settings, refer to Crop Settings section in your Operator's Manual.

item.para: Reduce amount of free grain in the tailings; allows more grain to fall through to clean grain sooner before it is recirculated in tailings.
Increase cleaning fan air flow; increasing sieve clearance allows more cleaning fan air up through the chaffer.

note.para: Opening of the sieve will also decrease pressure in the cleaning shoe. Large adjustments could require readjustment of the fan speed.

item.para: Improve sample quality; reduce the amount of foreign material in the grain tank.

note.para: To find the optimal setting for low tailings, high capacity, and grain tank cleanliness, increase sieve clearance until you see a dirty grain tank. Then, decrease sieve clearance until dirt disappears.

block.para: Adjustment States depending on machine options, different adjustment states may appear as current settings are changed.

step.para: Sieve Clearance Select to set the sieve clearance.
Adjustment Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease the desired sieve clearance.

item.para:
Input Field
Armrest Adjustment Dial Turn the dial clockwise to increase the value.
Turn the dial counterclockwise to decrease the value.

note.para: Depending on machine configurations, some values may not be reached.

step.para: Minimum: 0
Maximum: 22
Increment: 1
Minimum: 0
Maximum: 30
Increment: 1
Close Select to close.

block.head: Current Settings | Outside Configuration
block.para: Outside Configuration shows external machine adjustments that must be made prior to harvesting the selected crop type.

note.para: For more information, refer to the machine Operators Manual.

caution.para: Shut OFF engine, set the park brake, and remove the key before making changes.

step.para: Outside Configuration Select to access outside configuration.
Select desired outside configuration for further information on machine settings.

item.para: Chopper Speed
Tailings System Concave Position
Feed Accelerator Speed
Feeder House Conveyor Chain Sprocket

step.para: Close Select to close.

block.head: Current Settings | Adjustment States
block.para: Adjustment States show how the system adjustment settings react when machine changes are made.

note.para: Some items below are only displayed if machine is equipped with the associated option.
Operator-initiated changes are made using the display or the Armrest Adjustment Dial.

block.para: Progress Indicator Operator-Initiated Changes Progress Indicator.
Input Field Operator-Initiated Setpoint Value Input Field.
Performance Value The value displayed below the setting icon represents the actual performance value.

note.para: The actual value representing the system, which is below the icon, flashes until the actual value matches the new setpoint. Once the value reaches the new setpoint, it continues to display for 1 second before the value and progress indicator are removed from the screen.

para.emph: Combine Advisor and Initiated Active Terrain Adjustment Changes:

note.para: At any time, you can make manual adjustments while an Auto Maintain or Active Terrain AdjustmentActive Terrain Adjustment is a trademark of Deere & Company settings change is being applied.

The majority of adjustments made by Combine AdvisorCombine Advisor is a trademark of Deere & Company systems are offsets, meaning a setting is adjusted temporarily and reverted back to its original value when the system removes the offset.

block.para: Progress Indicator Auto Maintain and Active Terrain Adjustment Initiated Progress Indicator.
Input Field Auto Maintain and Active Terrain Adjustment Initiated Setpoint Value Input Field.
Progress Indicator Operator-Initiated Changes Progress Indicator.
Input Field Operator-Initiated Setpoint Value Input Field.
Performance Value The value displayed below the setting icon represents the actual performance value.

note.para: The actual value representing the system, which is below the icon, flashes until the actual value matches the new setpoint. Once the value reaches the new setpoint, it continues to display for 1 second before the value and progress indicator are removed from the screen.

The input field remains blue with "AUTO" printed on it to indicate that the system is maintaining the offset. When the system removes the offset, performance value returns to its value prior to the system making the offset.

block.head: Advanced Settings
block.para: Advanced Settings allow you to access further adjustments and less common settings.

para.emph: Items Accessible on Advanced Settings Page:

block.para: Separator Resolution Separator Resolution allows you to modify the number of bars shown on the Corner Post Display VisionTrak for the separator loss indicator (independent of the number of center bars).
Shoe Solution Shoe Resolution allows you to modify the number of bars shown on the Corner Post Display VisionTrak for the shoe loss indicator (independent of the number of center bars).

Loss Sensor Tap Test Loss Sensor Tap Test allows you to verify that various grain loss monitor sensors are functioning normally and detecting loss strikes. Select to open the grain loss monitor sensor tap test.

note.para: The grain loss monitor sensor tap test can also be accessed from the Calibrations and Procedures application.

block.para: Dust Fan System Dust Fan System allows you to engage and disengage the dust fan system.

block.head: Advanced Settings | Separator Resolution
block.para: Separator Resolution allows you to modify the number of bars on the Corner Post Display VisionTrak for the separator loss indicator.

step.para: Set to Current Harvest with the machine and press the Set to Current button.
Perform a Power Shutdown (see Operator's Manual for procedure).
Inspect for any grain loss from the separator.

note.para: If loss is present, determine if the loss is acceptable to the amount of bars indicated by the VisionTrak display.

item.para: The VisionTrak display does not indicate the amount of grain loss from the separator that is preferred.
Increase Separator Resolution to show more emphasis on grain loss from the threshing and separating section.
Decrease Separator Resolution to show less emphasis on grain loss from the threshing and separating section.

step.para: Advanced Settings Select the Advanced Settings button.

note.para: Slide Bar Slide bar displays the current resolution.

step.para: Separator Resolution Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease the separator resolution.
Minimum: -5
Maximum: 5
Default: 0
Increment: 1
Close Select to close.

block.head: Advanced Settings | Shoe Resolution
block.para: Shoe Resolution allows you to modify the number of bars on the Corner Post Display VisionTrak for the shoe loss indicator.

step.para: Set to Current Harvest with the machine and press the Set to Current button.
Perform a Power Shutdown (see Operator's Manual for procedure).
Inspect for any grain loss from the cleaning shoe.

note.para: If loss is present, determine if the loss is acceptable to the amount of bars indicated by the VisionTrak display.

item.para: The VisionTrak display does not indicate the amount of grain loss from the cleaning shoe that is preferred.
Increase Shoe Resolution to show more emphasis on grain loss from the cleaning shoe section.
Decrease Shoe Resolution to show less emphasis on grain loss from the cleaning shoe section.

step.para: Advanced Settings Select the Advanced Settings button.

note.para: Slide Bar Slide bar displays the current resolution.

step.para: Shoe Resolution Select plus (+) to increase or minus (-) to decrease the shoe resolution.
Minimum: -5
Maximum: 5
Default: 0
Increment: 1
Close Select to close.

block.head: Performance Target
block.para: Performance Target allows you to adjust the number of bars on the Corner Post Display VisionTrak for the shoe loss indicator, separator loss indicator, and total loss indicator to a level representative of the grain loss exiting the machine.

item.para: Changing crop type.
Harvesting conditions vary (wet crop versus dry crop, high moisture versus low moisture, variety A versus variety B, or large swings in seed size or yield).

note.para: It is not necessary to set a new target if you are using a recent performance target for this crop type and harvesting conditions.
Larger seed sizes, such as corn or soybeans, generally have a lower numerical calibration value than smaller seed sizes, such as wheat or canola.
Selecting a lower calibration value registers more bars on the display for the same acceptable grain loss.
Operate the machine at the desired performance and select Set to Current; this stores operating characteristics to memory and centers the total loss indicator.
Clicking Set Performance Target in Combine Advisor also performs an Automatic Target for Grain Loss.

block.para: Set To Current Select Set to Current to adjust the height total loss column of the VisionTrak display to the center of the column.
Input Box Select to open number pad and manually enter desired value.
Minimum: 1
Maximum: 99
Increment: 1

note.para: The Automatic setting is recommended. The Manual setting should only be used if the Automatic setting does not give the desired results.
Total Loss Indicator Total Loss Indicator bar graph is now a visual guide. You can refer to the corner post display periodically to know when an increase or decrease in the total loss amount occurs.

If the total loss indicator bar graph is above or below the green area and losses are acceptable, the grain loss monitor is either incorrectly adjusted or there is a higher flow of material through the machine since the grain loss monitor was last calibrated. Higher flow of material can be caused by increased ground speed or higher crop yields.
When the machine encounters a slug, the middle bar graph will fluctuate upward (15 to 20 seconds) and then return to the previous reading.Ignore these fluctuations when this occurs.

block.head: Access Engine

step.para: Menu Menu
Machine Settings Machine Settings tab
Engine Engine

block.para: Engine Application Button Press Engine button on navigation bar below display.

block.head: Engine Main Page

note.para: Engine Underscored text identifies that additional information is available within this section or another section of this publication.
Main page shown is for example only. Your main page may differ depending on options or connected equipment.

block.para: The Engine application is used to access and adjust engine settings.

para.emph: Items Accessible on the Engine Main Page:

note.para: Some items below are only displayed if machine is equipped with the associated option.

block.para: Engine Power Engine Power amount of power the engine is using.
Engine Hours Engine Hours accumulated engine hours.
Auto Exhaust Filter Cleaning AUTO Exhaust Filter Cleaning automated process that performs exhaust filter cleaning during normal operation as required.
Parked Filter Cleaning Parked Filter Cleaning process which allows the system to perform additional exhaust filter cleaning when required.
Air Compressor Air Compressor toggle button to enable or disable air compressor system.
Modules for this application can be added to run pages using Layout Manager.
Example:
Engine Power Engine Power shows engine hours and power output of the engine.

note.para: Different modules can be available for your application.

block.para: Shortcut keys for this application can be added to the shortcut bar using Layout Manager.
Air Compressor Air Compressor Shortcut Key allows you quick access to turn air compressor ON/OFF.

block.head: Engine Power
block.para: Engine Power allows you to view amount of engine power being used and accumulated engine hours. A power meter is available on both the display and the corner post display for visual indication of current power consumption.

important.para: If alerts or excessive exhaust smoke are visible, see your John Deere dealer or other qualified service provider for further diagnosis.

para.emph: Items Displayed on the Engine Power Page:

note.para: Some items below are only displayed if machine is equipped with the associated option.

block.para: Engine Power Engine Power amount of power the engine is using.
Engine Hours Engine Hours accumulated engine hours.
Keeps the engine and driven component speeds constant to enhance capacity and efficiency until rated engine power is exceeded.

item.para: Green Zone Green Zone operate engine at upper portion of the green zone to maximize machine productivity and maintain constant engine speed.
Yellow Zone Yellow Zone preferred upper limit in tough conditions. Less power bulge available in this zone.
Target lower range of the yellow zone before unloading auger is engaged.
Red Zone Red Zone peak power level and is not recommended for extended periods because no power reserve is available.

important.para: If indicator moves into the red zone, engine power is maximized and the machine could potentially stall. Reduce load on the machine until indicator moves back into green or yellow zones.

block.para: Operating in the following conditions increases power consumption:

item.para: Hilly terrain
Heavy or wet crop
Wet ground conditions
Excessive ground speed

block.head: Exhaust Filter System Overview
block.para: Your machine is equipped with an emission-compliant engine, which cleans and filters the exhaust. Under normal machine operation and with the system in AUTO mode, the system requires minimal operator interaction.
To avoid the unnecessary buildup of diesel particulates or soot in the exhaust filter system:

item.para: Auto Exhaust Filter Cleaning Utilize AUTO Exhaust Filter Cleaning mode.
Avoid unnecessary idling.
Use proper engine oil.
Use only ultra low sulfur fuel.

note.para: For more information, refer to Fuels and Lubricants section in the machine Operator's Manual.

caution.para: When AUTO or PARKED cleaning is enabled, the exhaust temperature can be high under no load or light load conditions at certain times during the exhaust filter cleaning cycle.
Servicing machine or attachments during the exhaust filter cleaning can result in serious personal injury. Avoid exposure and skin contact with hot exhaust gases and components.

During auto or manual/stationary exhaust filter cleaning operations, the engine runs at elevated temperatures for up to 45 minutes. To avoid injury or fire, verify exhaust filter, components, and outlet are free of debris. During entire cleaning process, keep exhaust outlet away from people, buildings, and anything that can melt, burn, or explode.

block.para: AUTO Mode automated process that performs exhaust filter cleaning during normal operation.
Disable AUTO Exhaust Filter in conditions where it can be unsafe for elevated exhaust temperatures.
Parked Filter Cleaning Parked Filter Cleaning process which allows the system to perform additional exhaust filter cleaning when required.
Engine Cool Down period of cool down after exhaust filter cleaning.

block.head: AUTO Exhaust Filter Cleaning
block.para: Auto Exhaust Filter Cleaning AUTO Mode allows the Exhaust Filter System to perform exhaust filter cleaning as required. Corner post display indicator and armrest display provide you with information related to exhaust filter system activity.
High Exhaust System Temperature (HEST) Indicator High Exhaust System Temperature (HEST) Indicator illuminates on the corner post display when the exhaust system temperatures are elevated.

caution.para: When AUTO or PARKED cleaning is enabled, the exhaust temperature can be high under no load or light load conditions at certain times during the exhaust filter cleaning cycle. Disable exhaust filter cleaning system in conditions where it can be unsafe for elevated exhaust temperatures.

note.para: System defaults to AUTO mode when parked exhaust filter cleaning is complete.

block.para: Disable AUTO Exhaust Filter Cleaning system in conditions where it can be unsafe for elevated exhaust temperatures.

important.para: Damage to engine components can occur if engine is turned OFF while performing exhaust filter cleaning or shortly after cleaning is complete. Alarm sounds and a warning message appears on display. Start machine and follow messages on display to allow components to cool. See Engine Cool Down In Progress.

note.para: If a filter cleaning is requested while the machine is stationary and not in harvesting mode, a caution will appear on-screen. After reading the caution, you must select Accept or Cancel before continuing.

block.head: Parked Filter Cleaning
block.para: Parked Filter Cleaning is a process which you initiate to clean the exhaust filter when required.

During the process, engine speed is controlled by the system, and the machine must remain parked to complete the procedure. Time required for the Parked Filter Cleaning process is dependent upon the level of exhaust filter restriction, ambient temperatures, and current exhaust gas temperature.

caution.para: When AUTO or PARKED cleaning is enabled, the exhaust temperature can be high under no load or light load conditions at certain times during the exhaust filter cleaning cycle.
Servicing machine or attachments during the exhaust filter cleaning can result in serious personal injury. Avoid exposure and skin contact with hot exhaust gases and components.

During auto or manual/stationary exhaust filter cleaning operations, the engine runs at elevated idle and hot temperatures for an extended period. Exhaust gases and exhaust filter components reach temperatures hot enough to burn people, or ignite, or melt common materials.

important.para: Damage to exhaust cleaning components can occur if engine is turned OFF while performing exhaust filter cleaning or shortly after cleaning is complete. Start machine and follow messages on display to allow components to cool. See Engine Cool Down In Progress.

note.para: Parked Filter Cleaning can exceed 40 minutes.

block.para: Abort Select Abort at any time during Parked Filter Cleaning procedure to cancel process.

step.para: Parked Filter Cleaning Select Parked Exhaust Filter Cleaning button.
Verify that the machine is configured for Parked Filter Cleaning.

item.para: Position the machine outdoors
Stop machine motion
Set engine speed to low idle
Engage park brake
Disengage separator
Clear proximity sensor
Engine debris management system functional

step.para: Checkmark Once a condition has been met, a green checkmark in box appears preceding the condition.
Next Once all conditions have been met, select next button.

note.para: Exhaust Filter System controls the engine speed to increase exhaust temperature.

step.para: Progress Indicator Exhaust filter cleaning is shown by Progress Indicator.
Close Select and a message appears on the screen that can be viewed in the Status Center on the display.

note.para: Cleaning process continues when close button is selected.

step.para: Status Center To check status of the procedure, select Status Center to open Status Center page.
Check Status Select Check Status to view the cleaning process.
Cleaning Complete System informs you when exhaust filter cleaning is complete.
Close Select to return to the display.

block.para: If you are not returning the machine to service immediately after procedure, allow engine time to return to normal operating temperature before stopping engine. See Engine Cool Down In Progress.

note.para: System defaults to AUTO mode when parked exhaust filter cleaning is complete.

block.head: Disable AUTO Exhaust Filter Cleaning
block.para: Auto Exhaust Filter Cleaning can be disabled in certain conditions.

important.para: Disable the automatic exhaust filter cleaning system only when necessary.

item.para: Indoors or under a roof unless a high temperature externally vented exhaust system is connected.
There is not enough time available for the machine to complete a cleaning cycle before it is shut down.
In high crop dust or chaff conditions.
Next to a fueling area.

step.para: Automatic Select to open Exhaust Filter Cleaning.
ON/OFF Select to enable or disable Automatic Filter Cleaning.
Close Select to close Exhaust Filter Cleaning.

block.head: Engine Cool Down In Progress
block.para: Engine Cool Down is a specific time period necessary to allow the engine and components to cool down.

important.para: Damage to exhaust cleaning components can occur if engine is turned OFF while performing exhaust filter cleaning or shortly after cleaning is complete. Alarm sounds and a warning message appears on display. Start machine and follow messages on display to allow components to cool.

para.emph: Access Engine Cool Down In Progress:

step.para: Engine Cool Down Icon Engine Cool Down In Progress alert opens on-screen showing the minutes left before the machine can be shut down.
OK Select OK on Engine Cool Down In Progress alert.
Status Center Engine Cool Down Icon illuminates in Status Center during Engine Cool Down In Progress.
Status Center Display Select Engine Cool Down icon to view Engine Cool Down progress in the Status Center Display.
Engine Cool Down Complete When engine cool down time elapses, the Engine OK Icon appears on-screen.

important.para: OK If engine is shut off during Engine Cool Down, an alert displays on-screen requiring the engine to be started.

step.para: Cool Down Complete message appears and tells you that the machine can be shut down. Select to close message.

block.head: Air Compressor
block.para: Air Compressor provides a supplemental compressed air source to clean the machine.
The air compressor only functions if the following requirements are met:

item.para: Engine must be running.
Machine must be in park.
Separator must be disengaged.
Header must be disengaged.
Machine external components must not be in motion.

important.para: Drain moisture from the air tank daily. Refer to Operator's Manual for details.
Never clean engine air filters or debris management air filters while engine is running.

note.para: Onboard Air Compressor is NOT recommended to inflate tires on the machine or run air tools.

block.para: Status Indicator Status Indicator displays status of Air Compressor requirements.
ON/OFF Select to enable or disable Air Compressor. ON/OFF toggle button is located on the Engine Main Page.

note.para: When the air compressor is active, the green status indicator pulses to remind you that certain machine functions such as separator, header, unloading auger and propulsion systems are reduced in functionality.
When preconditions are not met, selecting the ON/OFF toggle button displays Air Compressor Status to help troubleshoot what is preventing the system from activating.

block.head: Air Compressor Status
block.para: Air Compressor Status shows the requirements needed to enable the air compressor system.
ON/OFF Select ON/OFF toggle button under Air Compressor to open Air Compressor Status page if all requirements are not met.

para.emph: Items Displayed on Air Compressor Status Page:

block.para: Gray Not Ready requirements not met.
Gray Ready requirements met but not enabled.
Green Active requirements met and system enabled.

item.para: Engine must be running.
Machine must be in park.
Separator must be disengaged.
Header must be disengaged.
Machine external components must not be in motion.

block.para: Alert Message A message appears when a requirement is not met.
Check Mark Once a condition is met, a green check mark appears.
Close Select to close Air Compressor Status.

block.head: Advanced Settings

Reversal Ready Reversal Ready system is ready to begin manual reversal cycle.
Reversal Not Ready Reversal Not Ready system is not available.
Manual Cycle Active Manual Cycle Active during the manual cleaning cycle the status indicator will cycle between gray and green.
Auto Cycle Active Auto Cycle Active indicates that the system has begun a reversal cycle automatically.

note.para: Under normal operating conditions, fan reversal cycles will trigger automatically.

block.para: Fault Detected Fault Detected system is unavailable due to the presence of a fault.
Diagnostics Center Diagnostics Center press button to open diagnostics center for additional fault details.
Manual Reversal press the button to request a reverse cycle manually.
Service Clean Out press the button to request a full clean out cycle manually.

note.para: Service Clean Out is not available while operating in harvesting mode.

block.para: HVAC application is used to adjust temperature, fan speed, and air flow mode inside of the cab and view the outside temperature (if equipped).

para.emph: Items Accessible on HVAC Main Page:

block.para: Climate Control Automation Climate Control Automation enable to allow automatic control over air conditioning, air flow mode, and fan speed.
Set Temperature Set Temperature set a desired temperature inside the cab.
Air Flow Mode Air Flow Mode adjust distribution of air flow inside the cab.
Fan Speed Fan Speed control fan speed inside the cab.
Air Conditioning Air Conditioning (A/C) enable or disable air conditioning.
Modules for this application can be added to run pages using the Layout Manager.
Example:

note.para: Different modules can be available for your application.

block.para: Shortcut keys for this application can be added to the shortcut bar using Layout Manager.
Example:
A/C ON/OFF A/C ON and OFF quick access to turn air conditioning on and off.

note.para: Different shortcut keys may be available for your application.

block.head: Set Temperature
block.para: Set Temperature allows you to set a desired temperature inside the cab.

Decrease Select to decrease the value.
Increase Select to increase the value.

block.head: Fan Speed
block.para: Fan Speed allows you to control the fan speed inside the cab.

step.para: Fan Speed Select the screen area under Fan Speed to modify it.
Indicator The indicator moves to the selected fan speed or is turned off by selecting the minus (-) or plus (+) buttons.
Decrease Select to decrease the fan speed. The fan speed decreases until the indicator reaches the OFF position.
Increase Select to increase the fan speed. The fan speed increases until the highest setting is reached.
The fan is turned off when the indicator moves to OFF.
Close Select to close the fan speed setting.

note.para: Climate Control Automation When climate control automation is enabled on the HVAC main page, the fan speed decreases as the temperature approaches the temperature Setpoint.

block.para: CommandARM Fan Speed Control press fan speed increase or decrease buttons on armrest to modify fan speed.

block.head: Transmission Main Page

note.para: Transmission Underscored text identifies that additional information is available within this section or another section of this publication.
Main page shown is for example only. Your main page may differ depending on options or connected equipment.

block.para: Transmission application is used to display transmission information and adjust settings.

para.emph: Items Accessible on ProDrive XL Transmission Main Page:

note.para: Transmission application is not available when road mode is active. Press the Road Transport Disconnect button to turn road mode on or off.

block.para: Max Speed 1 Max Speed 1 maximum speed when max speed 1 is active. Select input box to adjust setting.
Max Speed 2 Max Speed 2 maximum speed when max speed 2 is active. Select input box to adjust setting.
Advanced Settings Advanced Settings allows you to access further adjustments and less common settings.

block.head: Max Speed 1 and 2
block.para: Max Speeds allows you to set a comfortable harvest or transport speed. When desired ground speed is set and multi-function lever is moved fully forward with the engine at high idle, machine operates no faster than the setpoint for the selected mode. Two modes are available.

note.para: Max Speed 1 cannot be set higher than current maximum speed set in Max Speed 2.
Greater maximum setpoints mean more aggressive machine movements. It is always best to use low range with a low maximum setpoint when doing precision movements (hooking up header).

item.para: Example 1: Attaching header to machine and harvesting desired crop. Max Speed 1 set to 1.6 km/h (1 mph). Max Speed 2 set to 11.3 km/h (7 mph).
Example 2: Waterway approaches and harvesting desired crop. Max Speed 1 set to 4.8 km/h (3 mph). Max Speed 2 set to 11.3 km/h (7 mph).

block.para: Value Select plus (+) button to increase value.
Select minus (-) button to decrease value.

note.para: As you switch between speed settings using the ProDriveProDrive is a trademark of Deere & Company Mode buttons on the armrest, a message appears on-screen reminding you of the speed settings currently active. The message can be viewed in the Status Center on the display.

block.head: Advanced Settings

para.emph: Items Accessible on Advanced Settings Page:

block.para: Tow Mode must be enabled to tow the machine.

block.head: Tow Mode
block.para: You can enable Tow Mode to protect transmission if machine is disabled and requires towing.

caution.para: Do not tow machine with wire rope. If rope breaks, the whipping action could cause bodily injury.
Do not remove couplers. When couplers are removed, brakes are disabled.

Avoid electrical line entanglement. Grain tank covers must be closed and the radio antenna must be removed before transporting. For further information, see the Folding application on the CommandCenterCommandCenter is a trademark of Deere & Company display and Radio Antenna in the Operator's Station section of the Operator's Manual.
Check local governmental regulations regarding driving or towing equipment on public roads. Use auxiliary lights and devices available from your John Deere dealer to warn other roadway users.
Avoid crushing injuries from runaway machine. If machine is on a slope, do not disengage park brake until wheels are blocked.
Machine can be towed for emergency situations up to 10 min at maximum speed of 10 km/h (6.2 mph).

block.para: To tow machine, proceed as follows:

step.para: Start engine.
Empty grain tank and remove header.
Swing unloading auger back.
Close the grain tank covers.
Swing ladder forward and remove the radio antenna.

note.para: Always tow machine in a forward direction by attaching a chain around the main axle. Be certain chain does not damage any hydraulic lines. Have driver in operators seat to steer machine.

step.para: Turn warning lights ON, unless prohibited by law.

note.para: Engine must be running to turn off park brake and tow machine. If engine is inoperable, see your John Deere dealer or other qualified service provider for further information.

step.para: ON/OFF Select ON/OFF toggle button to enable Tow Mode.
Message If requirements for tow mode were not met, a message appears displaying which requirements are not met.
Close If you need to exit tow mode for any reason, you can do so by selecting close button.
Green Checkmark Once a requirement is met, a green checkmark appears preceding the requirement.
ON/OFF Once all requirements are met, you can select the ON/OFF toggle button to activate Tow Mode.

caution.para: Prevent collisions between other road users, slow moving tractors with attachments or towed equipment, and self-propelled machines on public roads. Frequently check for traffic from the rear, especially in turns, and use hand signals or turn signal lights.

Use headlights, flashing warning lights, and turn signals day and night. Follow local regulations for equipment lighting and marking. Keep lighting and marking visible and in good working order. Replace or repair lighting and marking that are damaged or lost.

step.para: Press park button on armrest to release brakes before towing machine.

note.para: Operator must remain in seat for park to be disengaged.

block.para: Tow mode is disabled and a message appears on-screen that can be viewed in the Status Center if you:

item.para: Shift transmission into gear.
